title: How to Make a Solar Hot Air Balloon

steps.headline: Cut off the sealed end (as close to the seal as possible), and find the long edge of the folded bag that is folded several times over.
Insert the blade of a pair of scissors into one of the folds and cut all the way to the other end.
steps.description: You should be able to spread the bag open into a 3 feet (0.9 m) x 5 feet (1.5 m) sheet of plastic. Repeat this procedure for all 4 bags.

steps.headline: Join 2 bags together with masking tape, along the long (5ft) side of the sheets.
steps.description: You should have a 5x6ft sheet of plastic. Attach another bag to one of the 5 feet (1.5 m) sides, and then the last bag. You should have a long, 12x5ft sheet of plastic.

steps.headline: Join the two shorter (5ft) ends with the masking tape.
steps.description: You should now have a flat tube that measures 6 feet (1.8 m) x 5 feet (1.5 m).

steps.headline: Seal one of the open ends with masking tape.
steps.description: This is Seam A. There should be a seam at the center of the new seam.

steps.headline: At the other end of this seam, take the remaining open end and pull it open.
Seal this opening, so the seam is perpendicular to seam A.
steps.description: There should be 3 corners of the balloon.

steps.headline: Cut about 5 inches (12.7 cm) off of one of the corners, and invert the entire balloon like a sock.
Use a blow dryer to inflate.
steps.description: The sun will keep the balloon hot and can be flown on any sunny, calm day. A small fan will work, but since this is a small balloon it is hard, especially in wind, to heat up very fast. The balloon should be triangular in shape, or a tetrahedron.

text: Separate the 4 trash bags.  Cut off the sealed end (as close to the seal as possible), and find the long edge of the folded bag that is folded several times over.  Insert the blade of a pair of scissors into one of the folds and cut all the way to the other end. You should be able to spread the bag open into a 3 feet (0.9 m) x 5 feet (1.5 m) sheet of plastic. Repeat this procedure for all 4 bags. Join 2 bags together with masking tape, along the long (5ft) side of the sheets. You should have a 5x6ft sheet of plastic. Attach another bag to one of the 5 feet (1.5 m) sides, and then the last bag. You should have a long, 12x5ft sheet of plastic. Join the two shorter (5ft) ends with the masking tape. You should now have a flat tube that measures 6 feet (1.8 m) x 5 feet (1.5 m). Seal one of the open ends with masking tape. This is Seam A. There should be a seam at the center of the new seam. At the other end of this seam, take the remaining open end and pull it open.  Seal this opening, so the seam is perpendicular to seam A. There should be 3 corners of the balloon. Cut about 5 inches (12.7 cm) off of one of the corners, and invert the entire balloon like a sock.  Use a blow dryer to inflate. The sun will keep the balloon hot and can be flown on any sunny, calm day. A small fan will work, but since this is a small balloon it is hard, especially in wind, to heat up very fast. The balloon should be triangular in shape, or a tetrahedron.
